doc.field: Census 2000 Geography - Blocks, Block Groups, Tracts, TAZs, Counties, County Subdivisions and Water
Census 2000 Geography - Blocks, Block Groups, Tracts, TAZs, Counties, County Subdivisions and Water
U.S. Census Bureau and the Metropolitan Council
U.S. Census Bureau and the Metropolitan Council

This 'Redistricting' version of the census data is the first release of the data.
This 2000 census redistricting geography database of the 7 county metropolitan area and the additional 12 collar county area was developed from the U.S. Census Bureau's Redistricting Census 2000 TIGER/Line files.
The Metropolitan Council downloaded this data from the Census Bureau's FTP site, imported it into ArcInfo coverage format, added a few items to the coverage, then created block, block group, tract, county subdivision (city), county, taz and water coverages and shape files from the original data.

This 2000 census redistricting geography database of the 7 county metropolitan area and the additional 12 collar county area was developed from the U.S. Census Bureau's Redistricting Census 2000 TIGER/Line files.
The Metropolitan Council downloaded this data from the Census Bureau's FTP site, imported it into ArcInfo coverage format, added a few items to the coverage, then created block, block group, tract, county subdivision (city), county, taz and water coverages and shape files from the original data.</abstract> <purpose>For mapping and analysis of data from the U. Census Bureau.</purpose> <supplinf>Seven County Twin Cities Metropolitan Area and it's 12 collar counties.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>2000</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>2000</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-94.664</westbc> <eastbc>-92.117</eastbc> <northbc>45.736</northbc> <southbc>44.183</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt /> <themekey>census, demographics, census boundaries, 2000 census, blocks, block boundaries, census blocks, census block groups, census tracts, counties, county subdivisions, FIPS Place, MCDs, TAZs, water</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County, Chisago County, Isanti County, Sherburne County, Wright County, McLeod County, Sibley County, Le Sueur County, Rice County, Goodhue County, Pierce County, St. Croix County, Polk County</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>None</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Tanya Mayer</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1604</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax> <cntemail>tanya.mayer@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/Census2000Tiger.jpg</browsen> <browsed>Sample map showing the Census2000Tiger dataset.</browsed> </browse> <native>TIGER; ArcInfo 8.x</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <title>Census 2000 Redistricting (PL-94-171) Summary File Data (A Subset of Population Data)</title> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>Unknown</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>Each county polygon file is topologically 'clean'.</logic> <complete>All counties are included.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Presumed to meet source material standards: for 1:100,000-scale mapping, National Map Accuracy Standards state a horizontal positional accuracy of not less than +/- 167 feet for 90% of points tested.</horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr>Not applicable</vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale>100000</srcscale> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>Data originated at the U.S. Bureau of the Census, as 2000 Census Redistricting TIGER/Line files (02/07/2001).
www.census.gov clicked on TIGER clicked on Redistricting Census TIGER/Line (www.census.gov/geo/www/tiger/rd_2ktiger/tgr2kweb.htl) clicked on Minnesota or Wisconsin
3/27/01 Saved each of the 19 county WinZipped TIGER data files to disk
FIPS CODES 1. 027003 Anoka 2. 027019 Carver 3. 027037 Dakota 4. 027053 Hennepin 5. 027123 Ramsey 6. 027139 Scott 7. 027163 Washington 8. 027025 Chisago 9. 027059 Isanti 10. 027141 Sherburne 11. 027171 Wright 12. 027085 McLeod 13. 027143 Sibley 14. 027079 LeSueur 15. 027131 Rice 16. 027049 Goodhue 17. 055093 Pierce 18. 055109 St. Croix 19. 055095 Polk
Extracted each zipped file to individual county directories, for example, to .../.../census/tiger00/anok
Renamed all the Tgr27019.rt1 (etc.) files with lowercase letters (to tgr27019.rt1), 17 files per county in Windows explorer (required for Unix ArcInfo 8.1 to recognize TIGER files).
UNIX Workstation ArcInfo 8.1 (Create ArcInfo workspace in each county directory) Arc: cw . Arc: TIGERTOOL Usage: TIGERTOOL <tiger_prefix> <cover_prefix> (Join) (UTM STATE <zone number>) (1995 1996 1997 1998 1999 2000) (RESTART)
Via AML... Arc: tigertool tiger/%tgrprefix% %county% join utm 15 2000 Added items to the TIGER base coverage dissovled 7 coverages from the base coverage: Block, Block Group, Tract, Cousub, County, TAZ, and Water.
Added and standardized items, then, for each layer, map joined all 7 counties and the remaining 12 counties.
Created shape files from these 14 coverages.</procdesc> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref>2000 Census Block, Block Group or Tract</indspref> <direct>Vector</direct> <mgmg3obj>arcs, nodes, polygons, label points</mgmg3obj> <mgmg3til>For each themes, one layer for entire seven county region and another layer for the 12 collar counties of the 7-county region.</mgmg3til> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres /> <longres /> <geogunit /></geograph> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn /> <mgmg4par /> <otherprj /> </mapproj> <gridsys> <gridsysn>UTM</gridsysn> <utm> <utmzone>15</utmzone> </utm> <spcs> <spcszone /> </spcs> <mgmg4coz /> <mgmg4adj /> </gridsys> <planci> <coordrep> <absres /> <ordres /> </coordrep> <distbrep> <distres>2.54</distres> </distbrep> <plandu>Meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn> <ellips>GRS80</ellips> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys> <altdatum /> <altunits /> </altsys> <depthsys> <depthdn /> <depthdu /> </depthsys> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>STATE: 2 digit FIPS and state standard state code; e.g. 27, 55
CO: 3 digit FIPS and state standard county code; e.g. 163, 003
BLK00: 15 digit Census Block code (includes STATE & COUNTY FIPS codes)
TRACT: 6 digit Census Tract number
BLOCK: 4 character Census Block number
BLOCKGROUP: 7 digit Census Block Group number (Tract + 1st number of the block code)
WATER: 1 digit water code (1 = water)
COUSUB: 5 digit FIPS Place code for the county subdivision (city, township or unorganized territory)
MCD: Identical to COUSUB
COMCD: Concatenation of CO and MCD.
Information below is for ArcInfo coverage format only:
DATAFILE NAME: BLOCK_2000.PAT 10 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION 1 COL ITEM NAME WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC ALTERNATE NAME 1 AREA 8 18 F 5 9 PERIMETER 8 18 F 5 17 BLOCK_2000# 4 5 B - 21 BLOCK_2000-ID 4 5 B - 25 STATE 2 2 I - 27 CO 3 3 C - 30 BLK00 15 15 C - 45 TRACT 6 6 I - 51 BLOCK 4 4 C - 55 BLOCKGROUP 7 7 I -
DATAFILE NAME: BLKGRP_2000.PAT 9 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION 1 COL ITEM NAME WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC ALTERNATE NAME 1 AREA 8 18 F 5 9 PERIMETER 8 18 F 5 17 BLKGRP_2000# 4 5 B - 21 BLKGRP_2000-ID 4 5 B - 25 STATE 2 2 I - 27 CO 3 3 C - 30 BG00 12 12 I - 42 TRACT 6 6 I - 48 BLOCKGROUP 7 7 I -
DATAFILE NAME: TRACT_2000.PAT 8 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION 1 COL ITEM NAME WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC ALTERNATE NAME 1 AREA 8 18 F 5 9 PERIMETER 8 18 F 5 17 TRACT_2000# 4 5 B - 21 TRACT_2000-ID 4 5 B - 25 STATE 2 2 I - 27 CO 3 3 C - 30 TRACT00 11 11 I - 41 TRACT 6 6 I -
DATAFILE NAME: CTY_2000.PAT 6 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION 1 COL ITEM NAME WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC ALTERNATE NAME 1 AREA 8 18 F 5 9 PERIMETER 8 18 F 5 17 CTY_2000# 4 5 B - 21 CTY_2000-ID 4 5 B - 25 STATE 2 2 I - 27 CO 3 3 I -
DATAFILE NAME: COUSUB_2000.PAT 7 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION 1 COL ITEM NAME WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC ALTERNATE NAME 1 AREA 8 18 F 5 9 PERIMETER 8 18 F 5 17 MCD_2000# 4 5 B - 21 MCD_2000-ID 4 5 B - 25 STATE 2 2 I - 27 CO 3 3 C - 30 COUSUB 5 5 C - 35 MCD 5 5 C - 40 COMCD 8 8 C -
DATAFILE NAME: TAZ_2000.PAT 7 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION 1 COL ITEM NAME WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC ALTERNATE NAME 1 AREA 8 18 F 5 9 PERIMETER 8 18 F 5 17 TAZ_2000# 4 5 B - 21 TAZ_2000-ID 4 5 B - 25 STATE 2 2 I - 27 CO 3 3 C - 30 TAZ 6 6 C -
DATAFILE NAME: WATER_2000.PAT 5 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION 1 COL ITEM NAME WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC ALTERNATE NAME 1 AREA 8 18 F 5 9 PERIMETER 8 18 F 5 17 WATER_2000# 4 5 B - 21 WATER_2000-ID 4 5 B - 25 WATER 1 1 I -</eaover> <eadetcit>Redistricting Census 2000 TIGER/Line Files

By clicking below after 'Online Linkage' you will be able to download the 7-county metro shape files.
To download the shape files for the collar counties, click on this link: ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/Census2000TigerCollar.zip
Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/. The specific map service and layer name for this dataset can be found by clicking the blue or green boxes under the map service column of the DataFinder Catalog at http://www.datafinder.org/catalog/ .</ordering> </stdorder> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20010705</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Tanya Mayer</cntper> <cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> mailing and physical address </addrtype> <address>390 Robert Street North</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55101-1805</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651-602-1604</cntvoice> <cntfax>651-602-1674</cntfax> <cntemail>tanya.mayer@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn> <metstdv>1.2</metstdv> <metextns> <onlink>http://www.gis.state.mn.us/stds/metadata.htm</onlink> </metextns> </metainfo> <Esri><ModDate>20110729</ModDate><ModTime>13305300</ModTime></Esri><mdDateSt Sync="TRUE">20110729</mdDateSt></metadata>
